alert.note: Alert for Charles City; James City (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 2:49PM EDT until May 04 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Charles City County in east central Virginia... Southwestern James City County in southeastern Virginia... * Until 315 PM EDT. * At 248 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Ruthville, or near Charles City, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Holdcroft around 255 PM EDT. Rustic around 300 PM EDT. Williamsburg around 315 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Ewell, Chickahominy Shore, Governors Land, Sandybottom, Mount Airy, New Hope, Roaches Corner, Lightfoot and Centerville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
